sen.j: 鳥屋ミサンザイ古墳（とりやミサンザイこふん）は、奈良県橿原市鳥屋町にある前方後円墳。
sen.e: Toriya Misanzai Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped grave mound in Toriya Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.
Toriya Misanzai Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped grave mound in Toriya Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.
Toriya Misanzai Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped grave mound in Toriya Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: ミサンザイとは『御陵』（みささぎ）がなまったもの。
sen.e: The term "misanzai" is a corrupt form of "misagi" (imperial mausoleum).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term "misanzai" is a corrupt form of "misagi" (imperial mausoleum).
The term "misanzai" is a corrupt form of "misagi" (imperial mausoleum).

sen.j: ミサンザイと呼ばれる古墳は他にも各地にあるため、区別するために字名を付けて呼称する。
sen.e: Many tumuli across the country are called "misanzai" and are therefore distinguished by attaching the names of their locality.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many tumuli across the country are called "misanzai" and are therefore distinguished by attaching the names of their locality.
Many tumuli across the country are called "misanzai" and are therefore distinguished by attaching the names of their locality.

sen.j: （⇒ミサンザイ古墳）。
sen.e: (See also the section on "Misanzai Tumuli.")
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (See also the section on "Misanzai Tumuli.")
(See also the section on "Misanzai Tumuli.")

sen.j: 墳丘は前方部を東北に向けた2段構築の前方後円墳。
sen.e: The grave mound is two-storied and keyhole-shaped with its frontal part facing the northeast.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The grave mound is two-storied and keyhole-shaped with its frontal part facing the northeast.
The grave mound is two-storied and keyhole-shaped with its frontal part facing the northeast.

sen.j: 全長138m、後円部の直径83m。
sen.e: Its total length is 138 meters, and the back circular part is 83 meters in diameter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its total length is 138 meters, and the back circular part is 83 meters in diameter.
Its total length is 138 meters, and the back circular part is 83 meters in diameter.

sen.j: 前方部の幅78m、造り出しが左右にある。
sen.e: The frontal part is 78 meters in width with narrow terraces on both sides.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The frontal part is 78 meters in width with narrow terraces on both sides.
The frontal part is 78 meters in width with narrow terraces on both sides.

sen.j: 周濠をともなう。
sen.e: The tumulus is surrounded by a moat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus is surrounded by a moat.
The tumulus is surrounded by a moat.

sen.j: 外部からの観察ではあるが円筒埴輪と葺石が確認されている。
sen.e: External observation has confirmed cylindrical clay figures and stone pavements.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: External observation has confirmed cylindrical clay figures and stone pavements.
External observation has confirmed cylindrical clay figures and stone pavements.

sen.j: 古墳に接した鳥屋池の北東側の堤防下からは護岸工事の際に土器が多数出土している。
sen.e: A lot of earthenware were unearthed under the north-eastern embankment of Toriya Pond adjacent to the tumulus when bank reinforcement work was done.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A lot of earthenware were unearthed under the north-eastern embankment of Toriya Pond adjacent to the tumulus when bank reinforcement work was done.
A lot of earthenware were unearthed under the north-eastern embankment of Toriya Pond adjacent to the tumulus when bank reinforcement work was done.

sen.j: 同古墳のすぐ南には桝山古墳があり、ともに貝吹山から北にのびている尾根の丘陵を利用して造られている。
sen.e: There is Masuyama Tumulus immediately south of the tumulus and both tumuli are build on the northern ridge hills of Mt. Kaifuki.
There is Masuyama Tumulus immediately south of the tumulus and both tumuli are build on the northern ridge hills of Mt. Kaifuki.
There is Masuyama Tumulus immediately south of the tumulus and both tumuli are build on the northern ridge hills of Mt. Kaifuki.

sen.j: このため尾根を分断した南側は周濠が狭くなっている。
sen.e: This has caused the southern side of the moat beyond the ridge narrower.
This has caused the southern side of the moat beyond the ridge narrower.
This has caused the southern side of the moat beyond the ridge narrower.

sen.j: 東側の周濠は後世になって灌漑用に造られたため池の鳥屋池とつながっている。
sen.e: The eastern side of the moat was later added to Toriya Pond for irrigation purposes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The eastern side of the moat was later added to Toriya Pond for irrigation purposes.
The eastern side of the moat was later added to Toriya Pond for irrigation purposes.

sen.j: 池の中に古墳が浮かんでいるように見える。
sen.e: The tumulus therefore looks as if it is floating in the pond.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tumulus therefore looks as if it is floating in the pond.
The tumulus therefore looks as if it is floating in the pond.

sen.j: 築造時期は5世紀末から6世紀前半と見られている。
sen.e: It seems to have been constructed from the end of the 5th century to the early 6th century.
It seems to have been constructed from the end of the 5th century to the early 6th century.
It seems to have been constructed from the end of the 5th century to the early 6th century.

sen.j: 墳丘の前方部に東側へ方形に大きく突き出ている部分を持つという、非常に変わった形をしていることが特徴としてあげられる。
sen.e: It is one of this tumulus's characteristics that it has a peculiar shape with a large part protruding to the east in the front of the mound.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is one of this tumulus's characteristics that it has a peculiar shape with a large part protruding to the east in the front of the mound.
It is one of this tumulus's characteristics that it has a peculiar shape with a large part protruding to the east in the front of the mound.

sen.j: （剣菱形とも呼ばれる）。
sen.e: (This is called "kenbishi-gata" or diamond-shaped.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (This is called "kenbishi-gata" or diamond-shaped.)
(This is called "kenbishi-gata" or diamond-shaped.)

sen.j: この突出部分については、室大墓古墳のように陪塚が前方部に隣接した状態であるという可能性も指摘されている。
sen.e: Some scholars have suggested that like Muro no Obaka Tumulus the protruding part may have been part of a smaller tumuli built next to the frontal part of the present tumulus.
Some scholars have suggested that like Muro no Obaka Tumulus the protruding part may have been part of a smaller tumuli built next to the frontal part of the present tumulus.
Some scholars have suggested that like Muro no Obaka Tumulus the protruding part may have been part of a smaller tumuli built next to the frontal part of the present tumulus.

sen.j: 現在宮内庁により宣化天皇陵に治定されているが、より古い時代の古墳と考えられている。
sen.e: While the buried is now ascertained as Emperor Senka by the Imperial Household Agency, the tumulus seems to have been constructed in earlier times.
While the buried is now ascertained as Emperor Senka by the Imperial Household Agency, the tumulus seems to have been constructed in earlier times.
While the buried is now ascertained as Emperor Senka by the Imperial Household Agency, the tumulus seems to have been constructed in earlier times.

sen.j: 新沢千塚古墳群
sen.e: Niizawa Senzuka Burial Mounds
Niizawa Senzuka Burial Mounds
Niizawa Senzuka Burial Mounds

sen.j: 桝山古墳（倭彦命墓）
sen.e: Masuyama Tumulus (the grave of Yamato-hiko no Mikoto)
Masuyama Tumulus (the grave of Yamato-hiko no Mikoto)
Masuyama Tumulus (the grave of Yamato-hiko no Mikoto)

sen.j: 益田池堤跡
sen.e: Remains of Masuda Pond Embankment
Remains of Masuda Pond Embankment
